climbs.name: Strike It Rich
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger, Eh Ehrenfeld, and Eve Viga, December 1976

content.description: From the ground, face climb up and right past to bolts to a large flake.  The crux of the climb is between the two bolts.  Climb up the loose flake and dihedral to a belay (poor anchors).  Pitch 2 is  a steep, runout face, with loose holds.  This climb has been given stars for quality in some guidebooks, but I think it's a terrible route.
content.protection: standard rack and bolts, but there's not much protection on the second pitch
content.location: This climb is about two-thirds of the way from Solid Gold, around left towards Hex Marks the Poot.

content.description: Climb a thin face (crux) past two bolts.  Climb the flake above.  Near the top, an undercling leads to a 5.9 overhang.
content.protection: three bolts plus a standard rack
content.location: This is to the left of Hex Marks the Poot.

content.description: Climb up a blank rock past two bolts onto a patina face.  Clip a third bolt, heading right and towards the left facing flake.  Place optional gear while heading towards the four bolt.  Climb straight up past three more bolts to a three bolt anchor (90 ft).  Great climbing on a beautiful feature. Still cleaning up on the bottom.
content.protection: 7 bolts,  Two or three optional pieces of gear; thin to hand sized gear
content.location: 75-80 feet right of Hex Marks the Poot.  Base of climbing is nice flat level area perfect for staging.

climbs.name: If You Really Loved Me, You'd Buy Me A Turkey
climbs.fa: First Lead:  Todd Gordon et al., May 1991

content.description: Climb the easy fist crack of Hex Marks The Poot for twenty feet to a horizontal crack.  Do a hand traverse left along a thin crack, place protection, and do an exciting no hands step-up to a bolt.  Crux friction leads to easier but still fun face climbing and the top.  This route is very much worth doing.
content.location: This starts at the same place as Hex Marks The Poot.

content.description:
Hex Marks the Poot is an incredibly obvious crack (when standing near the Don Juan boulder) on a series of blocks leaning against the South Astro Dome. It is just left of the sheer northeast face of this formation.

Climb up the hand and fist crack past a horizontal rail, and then enter the off-width. Left side in, right side smearing on the face will get you up it. It's very fun but gym rats and posers will complain. Continue to a nice alcove with weird horns to sling and belay, or continue up the second pitch - a pretty right-curving crack (feasible as one pitch with a long sling or two). No fixed anchors that I could find but a rappel is easy with some long webbing around those horns.

The first pitch goes at 5.7 (possibly 5.7+ ?), and the second pitch at 5.8.
content.protection: An assortment of hand, fist, and large off-width gear sew up the first pitch.  The off-width is fairly secure so if you want to leave behind the 4.5 camalot you can.  Smaller gear for the second.

climbs.name: [Redacted]
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech,  Suzette Olsen, Norm Miller , Andrea Tomaszewski

content.description: This climb is located about 200 yards left of Hex marks the Poot (South of the E face of the South Astrodome.) Thin crack leads to face protected by 3 bolts.
content.protection: Thin gear and some QDs for the bolts.
content.location: Left of the SE face of South Astrodome.
